categoryContent.paragraphOne: Just because you did something wrong in the past, doesn’t mean you can’t advocate against it now.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: It doesn’t make you a hypocrite. You grew. Don’t let people use your past to invalidate your current mindset.
categoryContent.paragraphThree: Growth is a concept. Embrace it.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: Learn to do - and enjoy - things by yourself.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: You're going to miss out on a lot of fun if you keep waiting for someone else to accompany you.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: If you catch yourself thinking about the past remember - It’s okay to look back, just don’t stare.
If you are in your 20s, study personal finance like your life depended on it.
Don't compare your current life /financial /career situations to others.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: Compare it to your past self, and evaluate how the personal decisions you've made have impacted your circumstances.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: Almost everyone who is 'good with money' shares a common trait: they make a detailed budget for the next month and stick to it.
Your life doesn’t need to be special to be enjoyable.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: Having a regular job, food to eat and a roof over your head is more than almost every person who came before you or living now has had / have.
categoryContent.paragraphThree: Stop comparing yourself to crazy talented lucky people.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: Confirmation bias is real for everyone.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: Be aware of your own bias and seek your news from more neutral sources.
Ears don't repair themselves and earplugs to concerts are better than tinnitus for the rest of your life.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: After any unpleasant event in your life you should always stop to ask:
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: Did this happen to me or did I create it?
categoryContent.paragraphThree: It will help you either let go of guilt or take responsibility and grow as a person.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: When starting a new change in your life such as going to the gym or quitting smoking, avoid telling friends or family.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: Their positive feedback can give you a false feeling of accomplishment tricking you into thinking you have already succeeded which can hinder your efforts to change.
